front.title: PCN Boundary Node Behaviour for the Single Marking (SM) Mode of Operation

abstract.t: Pre-congestion notification (PCN) is a means for protecting the quality of service for inelastic traffic admitted to a Diffserv domain. The overall PCN architecture is described in RFC 5559. This memo is one of a series describing possible boundary node behaviours for a PCN-domain. The behaviour described here is that for a form of measurement-based load control using two PCN marking states, not- marked, and excess-traffic-marked. This behaviour is known informally as the Single Marking (SM) PCN-boundary-node behaviour.
